body:
### Problem

After https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34271, there is some weird behavior with floating windows and `win_set_config`. I initially had some problems with `snacks.nvim` and some border and winhighlight being broken, but I was able to find another weird behavior which probably has the same root cause:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/797d8c74-0282-4ca9-82cf-d188ef576cd6

Notice how the floating window moves when the title is set through the config

### Steps to reproduce

```foo.lua
local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(false, true)
local winid = vim.api.nvim_open_win(bufnr, true, {
  relative = 'win',
  width = 50,
  height = 10,
  col = 1,
  row = 1,
})

vim.api.nvim_win_set_config(winid, { border = 'single' })

vim.defer_fn(function()
  vim.api.nvim_win_set_config(winid, {
    title = 'foo',
  })
end, 5000)
```

`nvim --clean foo.lua` and `:source %`

### Expected behavior

I would expect only the `title` to change, and not something else

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

v0.12.0-dev-485+g33b0a004eb

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

macOS 15.4.1

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.34.1

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

Build from source
title: floating window `win_set_config` weird behavior
